thread.title: Cubs-Blue Jays? Mets-Royals? Which World Series match up do you want to see? (poll)
thread.title_full: Cubs-Blue Jays? Mets-Royals? Which World Series match up do you want to see? (poll)

author: Brent Axe | baxe@syracuse.com
title: Cubs-Blue Jays? Mets-Royals? Which World Series match up do you want to see? (poll)
text:
Comments 
No matter who wins the 2015 World Series, it is going to bring a long-suffering fan base a title. 
The Chicago Cubs have one of the longest title droughts in all of sports, winning their last World Series in 1908 ... when Theodore Roosevelt was president of the United States. 
If you believe Back to the Future II , you may want to put some money on the Cubbies. 
The Mets last won a World Series in 1986, when Bill Buckner ... and yeah let's not talk about that (Red Sox fan here). 
Kansas City's last title came in 1985. Royals' fans got oh-so-close last season when K.C. lost to the San Francisco Giants in the World Series in seven games. 
Toronto won the 1993 World Series on one of the most famous home runs in baseball history. It was the second of back-to-back titles for the Blue Jays, but they haven't been back to the Fall Classic since. No matter who makes it to the World Series, it should be fun to watch. 
Game 1 of the ALCS between the Royals and Blue Jays is Friday at 7:30 p.m. 
The Mets and Cubs start the NLCS Saturday night at 8:07 p.m. 
Which two teams do you want to see in the 2015 World Series? 
What do you think would be the best matchup? 
Vote in the poll then drop below in the comments section to give us your World Series prediction. 
Contact Brent Axe: Email | Twitter 
Listen to "On the Block" weekdays from 5-6 p.m. on ESPN Radio Syracuse
